projects.title: Production-Grade Component Library
projects.description: Build a comprehensive design system with reusable components, Storybook documentation, and automated testing
projects.shortDescription: Design system with Storybook, theming, and accessibility
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-quality component library with 15+ reusable components following atomic design principles. Implement theming with CSS variables, comprehensive accessibility support (WCAG 2.1 AA), and document everything in Storybook. This project demonstrates architecture skills, component API design, and ability to build scalable systems that teams depend on.

implementationSteps.title: Setup Project Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Initialize monorepo with pnpm workspaces or Turborepo. Setup packages: @yourlib/core (components), @yourlib/tokens (design tokens), @yourlib/utils. Configure TypeScript for strict type safety. Setup Storybook 7+ with MDX documentation. Configure Vite for fast builds and tree-shaking.

implementationSteps.title: Build Design Token System
implementationSteps.description: Define design tokens in JSON/TypeScript: colors (semantic + primitive), typography (scale, fonts, line-heights), spacing (4px/8px grid), shadows, borders, breakpoints. Generate CSS variables and TypeScript types. Implement theming system with light/dark modes using CSS custom properties. Build ThemeProvider component.

implementationSteps.title: Create Core Components (Part 1)
implementationSteps.description: Build foundational components: Button (variants, sizes, loading state), Input (with error states, icons), Select (custom dropdown with keyboard navigation), Checkbox, Radio. Use compound component pattern for complex components. Ensure full keyboard navigation and ARIA labels. Write unit tests for each component with React Testing Library.

implementationSteps.title: Create Advanced Components (Part 2)
implementationSteps.description: Build complex components: Modal (focus trap, portal, animations), Tooltip (positioning with Floating UI), Dropdown Menu (nested menus, keyboard shortcuts), Tabs (controlled/uncontrolled), Accordion. Implement proper focus management and escape key handling. Add Storybook stories with controls for all props.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Accessibility & Testing
implementationSteps.description: Audit all components with axe-core and manual testing with screen readers (NVDA/VoiceOver). Fix WCAG 2.1 AA issues: color contrast, focus indicators, ARIA labels. Write comprehensive tests: unit tests (90%+ coverage), integration tests for complex interactions, visual regression tests with Chromatic. Setup automated accessibility testing in CI.

implementationSteps.title: Documentation & Publishing
implementationSteps.description: Write detailed Storybook docs: component usage, API reference, accessibility notes, best practices. Create comprehensive README with installation, usage examples, theming guide. Setup automated releases with semantic-release and GitHub Actions. Publish to npm with proper versioning. Build demo site deployed to Vercel/Netlify showcasing all components.

projects.title: Web Performance Optimization Project
projects.description: Optimize a real-world React app to achieve perfect Lighthouse scores and sub-second load times
projects.shortDescription: Performance audit and optimization for production app
projects.fullDescription: Take an existing React application and optimize it to achieve 95+ Lighthouse scores across all metrics. Implement code splitting, lazy loading, image optimization, bundle analysis, and caching strategies. Measure improvements with real metrics and demonstrate the business impact of performance work. This project showcases your ability to deliver measurable improvements to production systems.

implementationSteps.title: Baseline Audit & Metrics Collection
implementationSteps.description: Run Lighthouse audit on production build to establish baseline metrics. Use Chrome DevTools Performance tab to identify bottlenecks: long tasks, large JavaScript bundles, render-blocking resources. Analyze bundle size with webpack-bundle-analyzer or vite-plugin-visualizer. Measure Core Web Vitals in lab and field (Real User Monitoring). Document all findings with screenshots and metrics.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Code Splitting
implementationSteps.description: Split code by routes using React.lazy() and Suspense. Identify large third-party libraries and lazy load them (e.g., chart libraries, rich text editors). Implement dynamic imports for below-the-fold content. Split vendor bundles to cache separately. Configure Webpack/Vite for optimal chunking strategy. Measure reduction in initial bundle size (target: 30-50% reduction).

implementationSteps.title: Optimize Images & Assets
implementationSteps.description: Convert images to WebP/AVIF with fallbacks. Implement responsive images with srcset and sizes attributes. Add lazy loading to images below the fold with loading='lazy'. Use next/image or similar for automatic optimization. Optimize SVGs with SVGO. Implement blur-up technique for better perceived performance. Reduce total image payload by 60%+.

implementationSteps.title: React Performance Optimization
implementationSteps.description: Identify unnecessary re-renders with React DevTools Profiler. Add React.memo to expensive components. Use useMemo for expensive computations and useCallback for stable function references. Implement virtualization for long lists with react-window or @tanstack/react-virtual. Optimize Context usage to prevent cascading re-renders. Measure frame rate improvements.

implementationSteps.title: Advanced Optimization Techniques
implementationSteps.description: Implement service worker for offline support and caching (Workbox). Add preload/prefetch hints for critical resources. Optimize font loading with font-display: swap and preload. Remove unused CSS with PurgeCSS/Tailwind JIT. Enable Brotli compression on server. Implement HTTP/2 server push for critical assets. Setup CDN for static assets.

implementationSteps.title: Measurement & Documentation
implementationSteps.description: Re-run Lighthouse audits and document improvements: LCP (target: <2.5s), INP (target: <200ms), CLS (target: <0.1). Setup Real User Monitoring with web-vitals library. Create before/after comparison dashboard. Write detailed blog post explaining optimizations and impact. Present metrics: load time reduced by X%, bundle size reduced by Y%, Lighthouse score improved from Z to 95+.

projects.title: Micro Frontend Application
projects.description: Build a scalable micro frontend architecture with multiple independent apps, shared state, and module federation
projects.shortDescription: Micro frontend with Module Federation and shared state
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement a micro frontend architecture using Webpack Module Federation or similar technology. Build a host app that dynamically loads multiple remote apps (dashboard, settings, analytics). Implement shared state management, cross-app communication, and independent deployments. This advanced project demonstrates expertise in large-scale frontend architecture highly valued at tech companies.

implementationSteps.title: Design Micro Frontend Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Plan the system: Host app (shell) acts as container, Remote apps (dashboard, settings, analytics, user-profile) as independent micro frontends. Choose technology: Webpack Module Federation vs single-spa vs custom solution. Define shared dependencies (React, router) and app-specific code. Plan routing strategy: host controls top-level routes, remotes handle sub-routes. Design cross-app communication: event bus vs shared store.

implementationSteps.title: Setup Module Federation Infrastructure
implementationSteps.description: Configure Webpack 5 Module Federation for host and remote apps. Host exposes: shell container and shared components. Remotes expose: entry points and specific components. Configure shared dependencies with singleton: true for React/ReactDOM. Setup development environment: run all apps concurrently on different ports. Use @module-federation/enhanced for better TypeScript support.

implementationSteps.title: Build Host Application (Shell)
implementationSteps.description: Create host app with routing (React Router v6) and navigation. Implement dynamic remote loading: lazy load remotes only when route is accessed. Add error boundaries for each remote to prevent cascading failures. Build shell UI: header, sidebar navigation, footer. Implement authentication and route guards. Add loading states and fallbacks for remote apps.

implementationSteps.title: Build Remote Applications
implementationSteps.description: Create 3-4 independent remote apps (Dashboard, Settings, Analytics, Profile). Each remote: independent build, own package.json, own CI/CD. Dashboard: data visualization with Recharts, KPI cards. Settings: form-heavy with validation. Analytics: data tables with sorting/filtering. Each remote exposes its entry component and routes. Use same design system for consistency.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Shared State & Communication
implementationSteps.description: Build shared state layer: use Zustand/Jotai for simple global state (user auth, theme). Implement event bus for cross-app communication using custom events or pub/sub library. Handle scenarios: user auth state shared across remotes, notifications from one remote visible in all apps. Add shared utility library exposed via Module Federation. Implement proper TypeScript types for shared contracts.

implementationSteps.title: Optimize & Deploy Independently
implementationSteps.description: Setup separate CI/CD pipelines for each remote app (independent deployments). Implement versioning strategy for remotes (semantic versioning). Add smoke tests to verify Module Federation integrity. Configure CDN for hosting remote entries. Implement rollback mechanism for failed deployments. Build monitoring dashboard showing health of each remote. Document deployment workflow and troubleshooting guide.

implementationSteps.title: Advanced Features & Production Hardening
implementationSteps.description: Implement A/B testing framework: load different versions of remotes. Add feature flags for gradual rollout. Implement shared component library via Module Federation. Add performance monitoring: track load time of each remote. Implement error tracking with Sentry for each remote. Build admin panel showing version info of all remotes. Create comprehensive documentation: architecture diagrams, communication patterns, deployment guide.
